My wife and I are dedicated Kindle fans and Amazon customers. They released the new line of Kindle's this week which made us both happy (it's the best e-reader out there and improving it even more is terrific) and a little frustrated. You see, my 2nd Generation Kindle is only 18 months old and is now 2 generations out of date. My wife's Kindle is a 3rd generation and less than 7 months old. I suggested to Amazon, through a web form, that they initiate a buy-back or loyalty credit program to allow 0Kindle owners to upgrade. I was a bit frustrated when I got an email response saying no, apparently from a call center in India. The form asked me if I was satisfied with the response. I clicked "no" and within 5 minutes, Amazon called me on my cellphone. I calmly explained my idea and the frustration of the very automated "no" response and they took everything I said on board. While they don't have a buy-back program, they gave me 2 x $40 credits to use against new Kindle devices. I should explain that I am an Amazon Prime member and that I do spend a couple of thousand a year between books, e-books, gifts, movies and electronics on Amazon, but they impressed me by responding well and recognizing loyalty.

I have been an Amazon customer for years. I order numerous products all throughout the year and their selection is PHENOMENAL. I am almost ALWAYS able to find what I need on the site. They offer brand new, refurbished/reconditioned and used products. The site is easy to navigate and has detailed, easy-to-use search options. You can save many items onto a personal wish list and also add items to your shopping cart to purchase at a later date, and you can add several shipping addresses and different payment options to your account.My most recent order included a Dolamee D5 brand Android TV box. I also ordered a wireless keyboard/mouse/remote combo to go along with it. I was under a 30-day Amazon Prime trial and so I got Free 2-day shipping on both items. (I was also able to find a HDMI to RCA/AV converter box on Amazon, since I have an older TV) All three items came within the 2-day shipping time-frame and they were packaged well. Everything worked like a charm with no problems whatsoever. Amazon always sends me reminders to review the products I purchase and I often do. In the rare case I ever need a replacement or refund, they make the process as simple and easy as possible. Amazon customer service is pretty good. They respond to my inquiry messages usually within 24 hours or less. The only reason I don't give them 5 stars is because there have been instances where the customer service I received resulted in an unfavorable outcome. This is extremely, extremely, rare, however, and does not occur anywhere near often enough to keep me from giving the site a high rating. I plan to continue to be an Amazon customer for many years to come.

I ordered an Amazon Fire stick. It was supposed to be delivered on 6th June 2023.I received an order confirmation on email. It stated the parcel had been delivered at reception. This is somewhat suspect because there is no reception area or anywhere safe to leave it, except with a neighbour. It wasn’t left with one of them. I enquired about this on Amazon chat. To be told the order status was updated too early. Strange… Apologies were given and the new order date was 8th of June 2023.Surprise, surprise…the parcel still didn’t arrive on 8th June. I called Amazon customer support and informed them about this. The customer advisor stated they need to speak to their manager. I explained they are in breach of contract the acceptables never arrived and funds have been taken. I asked for a full refund.To be fair, after the advisor had spoke to their boss. They stated I would have a refund in up to 5 working days. They also told me I could keep the items if they arrived. Of course, the items never arrived.I received a confirmation email of my refund being processed. Thankfully, I received a full refund including the postage and packaging I paid for too. Despite the initial frustration to start with, I’m happy I got a hassle free refund interaction. Although, I am somewhat reluctant to order from Amazon incase a parcel doesn’t arrive again.

Absolute worst company ever. Their customer service is terrible. I don’t know how they can possibly stay in business if this continues. In the past month, I’ve ordered 20 items. 5 of them have been late, 2 have been the wrong thing, and 2 never arrived. Of these 20 items, I’ve returned a total of 4 items. 2 because they were the wrong thing and 2 because they just were not what I was expecting.Of the two that never arrived, Amazon was so reluctant to refund me, they kept telling me to wait it out. The most frustrating thing was my orders showed if the item didn’t arrived by “__”date, then I should return and I would be refunded. When I did this, they asked me to wait longer. After reattempting this 3 times over the course of 6 days, each time they did the same thing. Finally, I was refunded. 2 other items I’ve chatted about and the reps have told me on separate occasions that I don’t need to return the item and I would be refunded. I then donated the items because they were what I needed, and a week later, I have no refunds. I chatted with their CS and they said I needed to return the items in order to be refunded. I told the reps that I didn’t have them anymore because I donated them since the last reps told me I didn’t need to return the items. You can guess how this ended… no refund. I told Amazon that I would send them a screenshot from the previous reps. They still would not refund me, they said that the other reps made a mistake and that I still would need to return the items. I am absolutely dumbfounded. These people just don’t get it. I’ve never seen a company contradict themselves more than Amazon. It is beyond frustrating. Their CRM system or whatever they use is horrendous. How terrible customer service that you don’t keep previous customer correspondence or stick to your word. It’s complete bogus. This company used to be pretty good, but now it’s the most frustrating company to purchase from. So sickening.

Amazon DecrepitudeI had trouble deciding whether to choose one or two stars for my review.In the past you could count on Amazon customer reviews to help you sort out whether a particular item was any good or not. Reviews would tell you about user experiences; how well the product worked, whether there were warranty claim issues, whether the item was suitable for a task, or even if a particular  vendor was untrustworthy or not.However, Amazon started adding Ratings which are not Reviews, simply some useless, lazy person simply giving stars (1-5) without any reason for the rating. Some products have tons of ratings without a single useful note giving a reason for the rating. This is especially infuriating when it comes to reviewing books. You click on what you think is a review and it turns out to be a rating, meaning there is no reason given for the star assignment. This is not very helpful to help you decide if you would be interested in purchasing a book.Later on Amazon removed all of the Comments that customers used to give additional information or commentary on a particular Review. This meant that warning about certain vendors failure to ship products on time, substituting products, shipping used items that were supposed to be new, or explaining why the negative review was a user caused, rather than a product problem.Removing the Comments on Reviews means that a TON OF HELPFUL information is gone resulting in the customer REVIEWS, are no longer as informative and helpful.Of course the worse thing that Amazon had done starting at least 10 years ago is that they lump reviews of different products together, presumably to make it appear that there are more reviews than actually exist. Whenever you purchase an product, you are invited, and encourage to leave a review, which is tied to the purchase of the exact item you purchased so there is no reasonable excuse for claiming that it is hard to connect the review to the exact item purchased. Amazon has all of the data that is needed to do this right.One terrible example of product Review LUMPING are those for Computer Hard Drives (HDs). Amazon lumps the reviews for old generation small capacity 500 Gb HDs, with all hard drives   made by a particular manufacturer with the largest capacity 18TB HDs. Now, the lower capacity HDs were designed and manufactured many years ago, using very different designs and components than those  newest, ultra high capacity HDs. These newest HD's that are very different from the older HDs, and use components that were produced most recently. We know that batches of components of the same design made at different times in factories may have quality control issues, hence Amazon's LUMPING practice defies reason and is DISHONEST.  Amazon will no doubt claim that their filtering menu takes care of this issue, but in fact that is false. You cannot evaluate the percentage of negative reviews (such as adding the two lowest star ratings together) without having these required data easily available. These are not easily found without counting every review. I certainly do not have time to do that, nor should that be required of anyone wanting to understand the review ratings. This would not be a problem if products that are not identical were not LUMPED together.LUMPING is misleading, and seriously dishonest, making it extremely difficult to make choosing a reliable product from Amazon. This practice should certainly stop, and the Review Comments should be put back if possible, and certainly re-instated.I have complained vigorously with customers support and even tried contacting Amazon upper management without success. Do away with LUMPING and get rid of Ratings instead of having Reviews! What will it take to get Amazon to fix these issues ?

I ordered an e-book (amazon.com) last evening, but after I pushed the button ’buy this book’ a small window appeared with the message that I already had bought this book a couple of years ago. This morning (26-1-’23) I got an email with an invoice confirming they had charged me for an e-book I didn’t buy because according to Amazon’s records I owned it already. I cancelled the ‘order’ with a request for refund. Amazon immediately started the refund-process. So far so good, were it not that Amazon (.com where my initial account is registered and all e-book purchases) removed the book in the library of my device (the one I already owned). As a frequent customer of Amazon's very 1st hour I loved shopping there (mainly books, paper versions & e-books). Its Customer Service used to be excellent. It was approachable by email, people working there understood what the problem was. Now it turned into a sheer nightmare. There is a chat option which is a complete waste of time. Spent exactly 2 hours reading hollow niceties such as “I really apologize for the inconvenience” and “I understand your concern regard the e book” and repeated ad nauseum, but the person was unable to offer a solution because he/she just didn’t understand what the issue was. After exactly 2 hours I stopped the chat because I had to attend a meeting.  A company that sells products under its own responsibility should have a well-functioning customer service. Refunds are not always the only solution. In my case I want to know where the (paid for) ebook is I bought a couple of years ago. The amount Amazon refunded today is the amount they charged me yesterday. Not for the book I already had and which they removed today. Just imagine a transaction with a much higher-priced product and a de facto defunct customer service. Inadmissible practices, Amazon!

****Latest entry*****So as my previous review went I have been happily shopping with Amazon since 2005 and the customer support has been exemplary.So what the hell happened, back to back to back issues, generic responses, can only us their crap chat or 'call you' which never calls me!Shambolic, gradually weaning myself off Amazon and shopping elsewhere.What went wrong!?!*****Original post*****It is quite hard to review a certain aspect of Amazon as they provide so many assistances, of which I subscribe to being a Prime customer, premium Amazon music and own numerous echo and fire devices. And failure in one part of their assistance will result in ordinary feedback for Amazon as a whole.So during this sermon (please try to remain awake) I have put down my past usages with Amazon and it's customer assistances which to date have been exceptional in resolving my past issues.I think some of the issue’s customers can usage with Amazon occur with the third-party sellers. Amazon overall does a decent job of mediating issues with the third-party companies, I myself have had issues in the past with a certain unscrupulous sellers and Amazon after some investigating offered a full refunded.An item that has prime order is not necessarily sold by Amazon. Top tip is if you are unsure who a seller is of an item check the right pane and just below the price and the ‘Add to Basket, Buy now, Add to list’ you will see it read Dispatched from and sold by Amazon. If it does not read this it is a third party company.A massive company like Amazon does not need me to put in a decent word for it. But myself included it is easier to write a ordinary review than a decent one, as we expect the assistance to be decent from the companies we use and rightly so.So this is me trying to balance the ordinary reviews I have posted with a semi-constructive review for a company that has rarely let me down, though the couriers on their behalf are another matter (yer I'm talking about you Yodel/Hermes stop putting my mail in the stinky green recycling bin when I have a garden box there right next to it!)Amazon Fan Boy out!!
Overall it was a good experience but their customer service seriously needs improvement.

I’ve been using amazon prime for let me guess lol I think like 5 year now never had a problem with them I enjoy the free two day shipping it’s amazing, & the fact that they actually take a picture and post it to your account showing that they left it by the door is straight peace of mind... so then you just know your neighbor stole it lol but your are for sure they delivered it. I’ve only had one wrong order and the seller immediately fixed it gotta appreciate great, fast & now somewhat more secure delivery 🚚 my husband hates them because I order just to much it’s a bit obsessive you can find any and everything from dishware to cute boots🥰🔥

XPO Logistics is the worst company ever. I ordered a play house for my granddaughters on Amazon . XPO Logistics was supposed to deliver it last Saturday. The drivers lied saying they knocked on the door. I waited all day thinking they were still coming. I received an email at 4 pm that night saying they tried to deliver but no one was home. I have two dogs that would have alerted me if someone was at the door.Then when I called to complain that they never tried to deliver the package the people on the phone where rude. Additionally, I found out they had my phone number wrong. I asked them to change it but I was told they couldn't change the number, I had to contact Amazon to have the number changed. The supervisor even refused to change the number or help me plus she was rude. "You didn't see a big truck pull up in front of your house ". My bedroom are in the front of the house not my living area so how would I see them pull up to the house.I called Amazon and changed my number plus let them know I was unhappy with the shipment provider. Amazon changed my number in the system. By Wednesday I still had not received a call to deliver the playhouse. So I called to find out why. The lady on the phone was actually helpful. She explained they where calling the wrong number despite the notes in the system giving the correct phone number. She actually changed my number so the organization could contact me when they were delivering.Today I was given another 4 hour window. I called to try and find a smaller window explaining I have things I need to get done (the stuff I couldn't get done last weekend because I waited all day). Again the lady on the line was rude and unhelpful.If you order something and find that this company will be delivering it. I suggest you find the item somewhere else. I am not ordering anymore large items from Amazon if they are going to keep using this company. XPO Logistics  has horrible customer assistance!!!! Amazon has not done anything about this organization that they paired up with.
In general i think their deliveries are a little slow and although they are cheap , they're not the cheapest. But for reliablity and overall quality of service you can beat them.

I ordered an external battery, airtags, and waterproof airtag covers. Some of the items were missing, and others arrived damaged beyond repair because the Amazon box had no packing around the individual items, and the weight of each item crushed other items and caused the tape to break on the Amazon box, allowing some of the items to fall out. I have contacted Amazon three times and spent over 3 hours on the phone, only to be hung up on. I have contacted them by chat 15 times with no help. One person finally said I would receive a refund but had lied. They told me to return the items through UPS, but UPS will not take the package because the items contain lithium and are dangerous to ship through the mail. I was then told to get a police report, but the police wouldn't write a report when the package was not stolen, and it was Amazon's fault for not packing the box properly. The items cost me $179.25, and I cannot get a refund, and Amazon refuses to help. They just reply with automated responses to return the items or get a police report. Still, I cannot do either because of the circumstances they caused by not packing the items properly for shipping. Buyer beware! Do not order expensive tech through Amazon because you cannot trust that they will be adequately packaged, and if they arrive damaged, Amazon will not issue a refund. I'm left with dangerous, useless items that I cannot dispose of.

I ordered an action camera from Amazon on Wednesday. It said One day delivery. I needed in one day or at worst two days as I purchased it to take on my honeymoon to Hawaii. It made it from TN to my state of NC overnight and showed out for delivery the next morning. I then get a message that my delivery is delayed and it will be Friday or Saturday before my package arrives. I leave Saturday morning at 7am for my honeymoon. As it stands it’s Friday night and it hasn’t showed up. I am now forced to cancel my order. I called customer support and filed a complaint. I cancelled my Prime membership (as it is obviously useless) and I will be closing my Amazon Prime Visa. For a company as big as Amazon this is unacceptable.

This is baffling to me because I made sure that ALL of my items was on Prime order so that I could get them before my vacation. I am NOT calling customer support again because I found out by an Amazon worker that they are only reading your order details from the same platform that we see our order.  So they are absolutely useless.  In compensation, they had out a measley $5 credit.  WTH is $5 on a $200 order???  It would be helpful for them to actually track the package up to calling the truck OR driver that has the package. I want to cancel my membership and stop paying for Prime because an 70% of my deliveries are not PRIME!  This is just ridiculous!

It used to be that if I purchase more than $35, it usually was Free Shipping.  Last few times I tried, it's a struggle to get to checkout and find that if I select the Free Shipping option, it automatically signs me up for Prime membership, even though I did not select that option earlier in checkout. I know it's able to be cancelled. But everything selectable towards Checkout doesn't inform me that the Trial Membership WILL be added, just that my purchase will qualify if I exceed $35.  I've never had to deal with that in the past and now never know what might have changed from order to order and need to proceed with caution.  So my complaint to Amazon is why do you make simple things so complicated?  So I find myself shopping for the same items at Walmart.com.  Update: I went to Walmart.com after this review and found the item. Originally, I had several things in Amazon Cart to exceed $35.  The one item I originally was looking for was only only $7 on Walmart and still got a speedy FREE SHIPPING checkout process.  HAPPY AGAIN.And now as I look back at the shipping details, it seems now the $35 is $58 to qualify, but most all the things I was shopping for still tout $35 to qualify. Too complicated.

Attempted to order multiple items from a baby gift registry.  I was prompted to remove the items from the registry after selecting them but then the items disappeared without giving me the opportunity to add them to my cart.  Then I searched again for the items only to find out they were no longer on the registry even tho I never got the opportunity to add them to my cart.  I called customer service since I wanted to ship them to the recipient's address but I got disconnected.  Then I called the main customer service number only to hear that due to COVID19, they can't help customers at this time and was instructed via a machine to chat online. I went online to chat then someone called me but I got disconnected again.  After several attempts I found out one of the products wasn't approved for shipment to my State. Additionally, I was told I wasn't the only call experiencing those issues and the gift registry dept was inundated with these types of calls...i.e. being prompted to remove items from a registry without getting the opportunity to add them to my cart.  Since there were only 3 other items on the registry, I attempted to get a gift card only to find out I can't use my amazon credit for that.  This was absolutely the worst customer service I ever encountered for an online company that supposedly is closing retail shops left and right!  I hope consumers wake up and realize what is happening...they are trying to create a monopoly so customers don't have other options.  I urge people to support retail businesses that are more customer service friendly rather than support a company that only hires people to ship overpriced items.

Amazon disguised it's philanthropy through unwanted marketing. Amazon has a program called amazon smile, where part of your purchase can be donated to a charity of your choice if you opt into the program. However, Amazon only allows you to participate in donating to these charities if you have your notifications turned on, which allows Amazon to send marketing messages--a suggestive sales technique. If you turn off notifications, amazon turns off your ability to donate part of your purchase to charities.

What ever happened to 2-day shipping for Amazon Prime membership?  And why isn't there a link somewhere about the Amazon website to contact customer support?  Why does it take about 5 minutes (not exaggerating) to drill down, answer questions, meet criteria and generally jump through hoops in order to get to the point where you can ask a question of a customer support rep?  I get that its HUGE but does that exonerate them from basic business practices and being available to their customers?  Is it impossible to imagine that there are some questions that can't be answered by the options they offer up in a list?The COVID pandemic wreaked havoc upon society worldwide and created new standards and expectations for and about work, workers, customers, customer supports, etc. and during that time it was impossible to fulfill Prime membership benefits like 2-day shipping, but it's long since and they've not yet reinstated the 2-day shipping policy. Go to amazon and look up prime membership benefits and the list includes video and kindle and music benefits but, all of those come with a monthly subscription fee separate from the $139 annual fee for Prime membership.  The shipping benefits listed for Prime Membership reflect two-day shipping on "select" items, so perhaps just the "select" item list got pared back during COVID and has never been 're-augmented'?Whatever the answer, I'm not sure Amazon prime membership is worth it anymore - certainly not if you're paying for it monthly; but perhaps even the annual membership doesn't make sense?It's rare that I need anything the next day or even two-days later and I'll frequently select shipment on my amazon shipment day, but when I do need something within' two-days, I'm finding Walmart to be more receptive to those needs (and they often deliver the next day AND on Sundays). Me thinks Amazon has gotten too big for it's britches and forgets the trail-blazing they once did only to foist buggy support upon us now. And don't get me started on dropping Amazon returns at a Whole Foods, especially one in NYC  The Upper East Side Whole Foods at 87th & 3rd has a huge Amazon Returns sign with that big smiley swoosh beneath it, so you know you're in the right place, but there's no additional signage to tell you to go to the Mezzanine which is accessible only by elevator (don't take the escalator bc it bypasses the Mezz altogether).

Absolute worst company ever. Their customer service is terrible. I don’t know how they can possibly stay in business if this continues. In the past month, I’ve ordered 20 items. 5 of them have been late, 2 have been the wrong thing, and 2 never arrived. Of these 20 items, I’ve returned a total of 4 items. 2 because they were the wrong thing and 2 because they just were not what I was expecting.Of the two that never arrived, Amazon was so reluctant to refund me, they kept telling me to wait it out. The most frustrating thing was my orders showed if the item didn’t arrived by “__”date, then I should return and I would be refunded. When I did this, they asked me to wait longer. After reattempting this 3 times over the course of 6 days, each time they did the same thing. Finally, I was refunded. 2 other items I’ve chatted about and the reps have told me on separate occasions that I don’t need to return the item and I would be refunded. I then donated the items because they were what I needed, and a week later, I have no refunds. I chatted with their CS and they said I needed to return the items in order to be refunded. I told the reps that I didn’t have them anymore because I donated them since the last reps told me I didn’t need to return the items. You can guess how this ended… no refund. I told Amazon that I would send them a screenshot from the previous reps. They still would not refund me, they said that the other reps made a mistake and that I still would need to return the items. I am absolutely dumbfounded. These people just don’t get it. I’ve never seen a company contradict themselves more than Amazon. It is beyond frustrating. Their CRM system or whatever they use is horrendous. How terrible customer service that you don’t keep previous customer correspondence or stick to your word. It’s complete bogus. This company used to be pretty good, but now it’s the most frustrating company to purchase from. So sickening.

I contacted customer service a few weeks ago to ask whether or not I would be reimbursed for expensive postage fees on a return I was making, and customer service told me more than once that yes, absolutely, I would be reimbursed up to £150 for postage costs. With this in mind I purchased postage via UPS which ended up costing £177.30. Now, however, Amazon is refusing to reimburse me, and every time I contact customer service to find out why and how to get my money back, they end the chat and ignore my issue. I've literally been lied out of £150 by a multi-billion dollar company. This is shameful and I will without a doubt be closing my account after this. I have told my friends and family about this and many of them have agreed that this was the last straw and that they will also no longer be using Amazon. You've got billions of pounds to play with, but you'll refuse to give me £150 that you promised me? Catch yourself on.

Amazon.com is a website so huge that its impossible to ignore their impact on society and retail as a whole, they have driven several competitors into bankruptcy including mom and pop stores who cant compete on price, small/medium sized competitors by lowering their prices on items (like baby items) which forces their small/medium sized competitor to lower prices to compete with Amazon and then after they go out of business Amazon will raise their prices when there is no competition around (this has been in news articles). Amazon has also been in the news for things like their poor treatment of fulfillment center employees by timing how many seconds they take to pick an order and pack it, limiting bathroom breaks, and making workers work during Covid-19 even though several of their employees got Covid-19 in their fulfillment centers.  So why do you ask do i keep buying from a company like this? for one simple reason, convenience. Amazon has a huge selection of items, they allow for easy and FREE returns within 30 days where other competitors charge restocking fees for returns and make returns at customer expense for shipping costs. Amazon also has a presence in many countries, ive purchased stuff from Amazon Japan, Amazon UK and had the items shipped to the United States very easily.So why did I rate Amazon.com 3/5? well because while they may be very convenient to buy from they also have very poor packaging and dont let customers specify what kind of packaging they want their items shipped in. Amazon has gotten some heat from environmental groups trying to get them to cut down on plastic and cut down on cardboard boxes in the past and we still see petitions online constantly being opened about their packaging. A simple solution would be to let the customer choose what kind of packaging they want their items shipped in during the checkout process and if theres an extra costs associated with more packaging materials then the customer can decide if they want to pay the extra costs or not. I would totally welcome the ability to choose what packaging material Amazon uses for my orders because I would love to be able to order things like art books, movies, collectibles, and video games from Amazon but whenever I try to order any of these items from Amazon they ship the items in a plastic padded envelope 99% of the time or a cardboard box without any packing paper or void fillers and when I finally receive the item it will be all scuffed up or dented during shipping, have a loose disc (movies and video games), or be damaged in some other way so I would have to go through the trouble of returning the item back to Amazon which isnt acceptable for the environment either since it would costs more fuel and packaging material to be sent back to Amazon. The combination of Amazon's business practices, their poor treatment of fulfillment center employees, and their poor quality packaging which prioritizes getting the package to the customer as fast as possible over the condition that the items arrive in at their destination are the reasons why I gave Amazon a 3/5 score.

Just bad.And if you’re not happy with the product or the service, you can’t leave reviews like before! You can’t say it’s late! Or didn’t arrive ! I can't begin to describe how far Amazon has fallen over the years.  I was a customer from the beginning.  I was with Prime shortly after it came out.  I seriously thought it was the best company in the world, until it wasn't.  Then it wasn't even close.  Amazon now has among the worst customer service I encounter anywhere.  It rivals Comcast and Verizon Fios for the worst service you can even conceive of.  There's literally no way to describe the thousand ways Amazon fails at basic stuff.  It's service is a nightmare now.  You're sent off to a foreign country, with people who are supremely unhelpful, with the simplest issues taking hours to resolve.  I'm over it.  I no longer trust Amazon.  It's that simple.  Most recent case in point: I called Synchrony Bank, the issuer of the Amazon store card, to pay my bill.  It said the balance was over $400, so I thought I'd go through to a live person and see what the purchases were, to make sure nothing was unauthorized.  I recognized every purchase, except one.  There was an $11 charge for Amazon digital services.  I knew I hadn't authorized any digital purchases, so told them to put me through to Amazon.  The Indian man I spoke with was completely unhelpful.  Mind you, I mean him or anyone else no disrespect for being foreign.  He spoke with a thick accent likely because English was his second language.  GOOD FOR HIM.  It's something to be proud of.  But it also makes it very difficult to take care of issues that have any degree of complexity at all. He insisted I definitely ordered Amazon Music Unlimited, because I played [unintelligible] on my Alexa device.  What was the name of it?  "It was [unintelligible]"  HUH?  SAY THAT AGAIN SLOWLY?  Literally, his accent was so thick I couldn't tell at all what he was saying.  After repeating it a fourth time, I made out the word "noise."  It hit me that Amazon was charging me $11 a month to play "brown noise" on my bedroom Alexa device.  I've played that as a background sleep noise for YEARS.  Didn't start in December.  I've literally played it for about 3-5 years, every single night.  Suddenly it apparently started charging me for it in December.  I never heard it ask me ANYTHING about a subscription and certainly never agreed to any such thing.  But that didn't convince this Amazon rep, who apparently could read my mind and insisted I absolutely did order it.  I grew increasingly annoyed, especially as he kept going silent for 20, 30, 40 seconds at a time without saying a word, no hold or anything.. just silence.  Finally I told him, "why are you being silent?  I don't know what you're doing."  He then hung up on me.  So much for customer service.  I called angrier now and spoke with a second rep.  She was so very sorry the first rep hung up on me.  If I would just take more time out of my Saturday night to explain everything all over again and verify myself again... which I had no choice but to do.  She took a complaint on the last rep, but said she couldn't help me.  I'd have to be transferred to Amazon music.  Mind you, by this time it's nearly 1 am in the morning on a Sunday morning.  She puts me on hold... and I wait and I wait and wait some more.  About 15 minutes she comes back and says "I'm sorry for the long wait.  I'm still in the queue to speak with Amazon music."  I told her I would wait.  She puts me back on hold... 20 minutes pass... 30 minutes pass... 40 minutes pass.  Finally I had to give up.  She never came back on the line to say anything.  Just the same canned music playing over and over and over and over on a loop.  Called again.  Asked for a supervisor, but my phone died because I'd been held on the line so long.  He didn't call back.  I gave up because I had to give up.  Otherwise, I'd have a stroke from my anger and high blood pressure.  Amazon, you suck. Every single time I have a problem now, this is what I encounter.  Amazon is no longer a great company.  It's a company that will cut every corner, that disrespects its customers and their time, and that cares only about its bottom line.  It will go the way of Sears because it deserves to.

Amazon as a whole is an ok company. Each time I deal with a customer representative I am satisfied with the results however, this new shipment system they have is faulty. I dont mind waiting, if that's what the item I am buying states but if it says it will be here on a Tuesday then I expect it to be here on a Tuesday. I pay 100+ a year to have this assistance. 4 stops and 5 miles away from my home the driver decides to mark the package with "attempted" shipment. I called Amazon and filed a report and they could see the driver was no where near my residence at time of "attempted" scan. If you take on a job, do it, or you shouldn't get paid. This kind of misuse of Amazon's time and customer complaints will eventually end up in the consumer pocket since Amazon will lose money hiring lazy drivers.

I've been a monthly customer of Amazon for years and have 2 primary complaints about the online shopping support. 1)I gave fare/honest reviews of merch I purchased - mostly an adequate rating, a few average and a few excellent reviews - but Amazon removed my ability to review for a couple years now without adequate explanation. I feel duty bound to warn other customers about items I've purchased that are advertized fraudulently or defective, which Amazon does not allow me to do. I expect Amazon as a middleman support suffers from conflict of interest when it comes to the various companies for which they brokers, so it censors reviews for the businesses it's too close to, in order to protect its sells. This is siding with these companies that sell substandard merchandise against Amazon members, and should immediately stop. Ever paying Amazon shopper should have an unhindered right to review the items they paid for.2) Amazon listings needs to clarify differences in sizing scale when merch is manufactured in different countries, which it most often fails to do. For example, I cannot tell you number of times I purchased items manufactured in China, according to Chinese sizing scale - which is about 2-sizes smaller than US sizing - without being warned by Amazon. The result being, merchandise That doesn't fit - clothes, backpack, laptop case - I either haveto go through headache of returning, just givaway, or trash.
It's okay but they should add a method to verify the items they send to their customers.

They have the worst customer service ever. Order a pc case on the 28th says over night shipping gets delayed a day. Then I get it and it's broken and they refused to refund it after about 10 people they finally decided since the panels are glass and were broken but the frame is still okay I could get a return. I set it to have it go to my Amazon account so I could repurchase a different case. I got a email saying the item was picked up.  But no money went into my account.  I called them and they said it was going back on my debit card and now couldn't change it since it was already being done with.  I said how Is it my fault you guys put the return wrong after them literally repeating it would go into my Amazon balance but then them not doing.  The lady then proceeded to say it's not our fault you messed up.  I explained why I wanted it on my account and proceeded to make excuses on why they messed up and put it on my card. Then said It would take 14 days to swap the return label so it could go on my account I said never mind DONT change anything I will deal with the 3 days to my card instead.  Then I got a email 5 minutes after the like 15th call that they were going to start the label swap process which would take 14 to 30 days.  I called them back got a lady name Dany who was no help at all and did not listen or understand what I was saying. Then I got a guy who was super good and said the person who sent that email must've been trying to get under my skin. Cause he saw the email saying the relabeling process would start and would be changed to go onto my amazon balance after me telling them never mind leave it. And he said I see that message but it was never changed so whoever sent the email was trying to upset you.  Worst customer service ever now I will not be able to order my new pc case for 3 to 5 more days. 10 days after it being ordered.  They would my offer any compensation for the troubles they caused because my situation did not qualify. Like how does it not quality! They made it nothing but a problem with this whole order.  If I could leave negative stars I would I should have to speak to almost 20 people to get anything done

I was trying to change my default credit card from Amazon Visa to another credit cared. The site would absolutely not do it. He very kindly came into my porch to hide the package so my surprise wouldn't be ruined! How thoughtful!! I've never had a delivery driver so thoughtful and kind - how amazing! it must be such a busy/stressful time on 23rd dec and yet he still took the time to help (and waited at the door a long time as it took me ages to find my key). I always get deliveries quickly and efficiently but this was exceptional!! Thank you!!

The company has stated that after three years, the employees are 'lazy'. They pay you to leave. Instead of fixing the speed of shipping, why not fix the employee situation?. These are human beings. Even the ones with color do not get treated fairly. Even though Amazon has a 'black lives matter' thing on their website or advertisements, it is lie.I say to myself, it is not just with the people you see at a store, to me, it is about the whole company, is the CEO willing to change something’s about their company. I hope the employees are striking for more respect, who does the harder work?, the employees. I still have not used the app. I am glad. I feel for those employees with the holiday season coming up.

Christmas is currently ruined because of Amazon.  I had expected 3 packages today from Amazon. I then spent 2 hours trying to find out where my packages had been sent to.  Amazon couldn't contact the driver to re-deliver which is ridiculous!!!  I am so upset by the whole incident that I will no longer be using Amazon.

You shop on Amazon.  You find what you want.  One of the reasons you shop here is because of their shipping.  You place your order because Amazon promises your package will be delivered on a certain day.  Then you wait because your package doesn't come.  After they take your money and send you a confirmation telling you when you will get it, you don't get it, and you get an email saying sorry it's late, and if you don't get it by this day, you can have your money back.
Amazon has earned my trust across hundreds of orders over many years. When something went wrong, they have always refunded my money, no questions asked. I'm grateful for the hassle-free experience!

I received emails from Amazon 1.) on Dec 1st, order confirmation. 2.) on Dec 7th, my item has shipped and I should expect it by Dec 8th. From one customer service (CS) rep to another rep, then supposedly one cs team leader to another cs team leader, I got the same answer they don't know what happened to my grandson's Christmas gift. They kept telling me that they can no longer give me my item I payed for and was told I would receive it proof of emails received by Amazon. I tried all over the web to find Amazon's Executive contact information. I called the executive office's where they would not give me any executive to talk to about my problem. I sent emails to a few executives but no answer as of yet, jeff at amazon being one of them. The only thing I can see is that when I purchased my item on Dec 1st it was selling for $129.99, now it up to $400.00. They must have seized my item to make more money selling it to someone else. At first, I really loved using Amazon.  Their two-day order was spot on, and I could order anything and trust the goods.  Now, it feels like I’m always trying to check with myself as to why I’m paying this membership!  Two-day order is bs.  I’ve had several two-day order packages be delayed.  One was a birthday present for my 6 year old nephew.  We postponed leaving until the next morning because Amazon said the order would be there in two days.  Right at the 9pm end of day order mark, Amazon sends a shipment delay note saying it may not be for another 5 days.  The tracking showed it was in my city.  Why would that take 5 days?!  Im beginning to wonder what I pay this membership for.  The two day shipping has gone to the wayside, and I’m beginning to not believe in Amazon’s promise any more...or the quality of the goodss sold.  Don’t say you can do something if you can’t.  False advertising, Amazon.  Maybe I should take my membership to Walmart, Amazon.  What do you think about that?  I’m not a fan, but they seem to be getting themselves squared away to be completion.

I ordered two of the exact same sweatshirts from Amazon 2 weeks ago. The only thing different was the color. One of them arrived within four to five days. It was from the same order, same address, same everything.  How could one get there with no problem and the other one couldn't find its way to my home....so they just sent it back to the "third party shipper"?  My account was credited, but I question how one part of my order arrived with no problem but for the other part of the order they couldn't find me?

So, satisfied sadly after this refund is processed i will no longer bee ordering anything from Amazon again, and i took screen shots of the conversation and how rude this person was and i will be on every platform i can find leaving reviews about this. So, not only did Amazon lose me as a customer today but they also lost everyone of my family members and friends that use Amazon. We will be ordering from TikTok shop and ebay from now on. TikTok shop usually has better prices and neither one of them have ever been rude like this to me before and never have i ever had something delivered to me ripped up and i get blamed basically for it and get told I'm basically screwed on getting my money back for a month and a half. I have only had one package come messed up from another place and i contacted customer support and they gave me a choice of getting refunded or i could have the same thing i ordered mailed out that day, to wait on my money for a month and a half is absolutely ridiculous and unacceptable especially when it's either Amazon's fault or the delivery company THEY USED to have my order delivered. I guess you guys at Amazon forget that us customers are the ones that keep you employed and for you to treat your customers that spend alot of money with you the way you treated me is beyond crazy. So, congrats Amazon keep it up and I'm sure you'll be losing alot more. Hope you enjoy this terrible review on every platform i find showing everyone how you treat people.

Amazon's Customer service is useless and their policies are amazingly stupid. I placed an order on 10/27/20 that had a ONE-Day shipping guarantee with a delivery the following day after shipment. Well 2 days later on 10/29/20 after waiting all day and getting a message that the package was on the way and would arrive between 1:45 pm to 5:45 pm I received a later message saying the package was delayed and now they would be sending the items in two separate delievries on 10/30 and 10/31. This was not the guarantee on their website nor is it the 2 day shipping I pay for as a Prime Member. Needless to say I was a bit upset as this is not the only time this has happened and so I cancelled the order fully expecting to be credited back my money straight away, fast forward to today 11/3/20 and I still have not received a refund and to make matters worse I'm being told by Amazon customer service that I need to wait for the items to ship back to the warehouse before they even begin to process the refund. What?,Why? The package never left Amazon's chain of custody since it was being delivered by their carriers, so how is it that I have to wait for it to get back to the warehouse when they should be able to scan the items as a return right there and begin the refund process? I have sent returns before through UPS, FedEx and the regular mail and the second the package is scanned the refund process begins immediately, but somehow even though Amazon's carriers are in possession of the package they refuse to begin process of the refund until the package physically reaches their warehouse and I have to wait X amount of days with no way to track the progression of the items to get my money back....this is NOT okay, Amazon!! What happens if the items never make it to your warehouse even though your carriers where the last ones holding the package? Do I not get my money back because your employees left my package in the back of their truck and forgot to make the return? This is why I think their return policy regarding cancellations is a confusing mess. They should have a way to track the eta of items being returned to their warehouses and should not penalize the customer and make them wait for a refund if the carriers were Amazon drivers in the first place. This is just not a good way of doing business and feels like they are actually trying to steal money from their customers with this insane policy. (again, they have the package already...it's just not in the warehouse)In the beginning Amazon was great but it has started to slowly go downhill in quality of goods sold through and fulfilled by them and quality of their service through deliveries and customer service. After this last wake up call I will no longer be returning as a member and will be taking my online shopping business elsewhere. I'm sure this won't matter to them but it matters to me to do business with a company that cares for it's customers. GoodBye Amazon, and If I don't receive my refund I will be filing a complaint with the ftc or bbb.

I purchased a dive watch from Amazon on 8/29/23. The item came on time. However, it was defective. So, rather than get a refund, I ordered a replacement on 9/2/23. The package was supposed to arrive in two to three days. I am still waiting for the item. It is now almost 9/18. I am a Prime customer, and have spent quite a lot of money with them over the years. I've called their customer assistance numerous times. I keep getting the same scripted answers. Sounds like a run-around to me. The item is in transit, they keep repeating. When I checked the USPS tracking history, the last date is 14 days ago, on 9/4/23, stating awaiting receipt of item. In other words, the Post Office hasn't even received the package. Even Amazon's own website says the package may be lost, and to request a refund or replacement. I was told to call back on 9/20 for them to investigate further. That's 18 days since I ordered the item. What a joke. I barely can understand these reps over the phone. Sound familiar? This is the last time I will ever order a big-ticket item from them. Before, Amazon promptly refunded me or sent out a replacement right away. This is how you lose loyal customers!Post Script (9/26/23): I was finally issued a refund,18 days after I purchased the watch. The item never arrived, nor did the USPS ever receive my package. I got an email from their customer assistance saying that the package was deemed 'not deliverable' and sent back to an Amazon facility. Just what I was telling them all along. As a Prime customer, I should not have to wait nearly three weeks. Amazon could have sent me a replacement. Again, this is not a fine way to treat their loyal customers.

Sold me devices that I cannot useAmazon have sold me devices, falsely claiming that they allow me access to my music, to call my family, to stream video, etc. and I am unable to ANY of this on the devices at all. Amazon REFUSE (SEVEN attempts so far) to remove 2-factor authentication from my account meaning that I cannot register or access ANY of my devices (Echo, Echo Show, etc.). I have provided proofs of who I am (driving licence, passport, Iqama, etc.) as requested and STILL they refuse to remove this 'feature' despite PROMISING every time to do so. No only is this false advertising, it is also breaking the law under the UK Data Protection Act by denying me access to information that they are holding about me.

I used to be a huge Amazon promoter. Their prices might have been slightly higher but reasonable when factoring in the whole experience including shipping times, customer service, ease returns etc. They will tell you that their shipping times remain unchanged, based on the fact that it's 2 days from the actual shipping of the item. The reality is I used to receive things in 2 or three days depending on the time of day I ordered it. Most days they'd ship it out the same day. Now they have a built in 5 day delay to ship resulting in 1 week delivery. Walmart plus still has true 2 day shipping. I'm cancelling my Prime subscription.

Fraud. Bought a piece of furniture listed as sold and shipped by amazon. Amazon changed the order after it was made so it was shipped by a third party instead. The third party took our money, never sent the product, then went out of business. Amazon tried to leave us on the hook for the purchase even though the listing did and still shows they were the ones selling it. When we asked them to look at it, they claimed they can’t see their own listings and the the screenshot my husband sent couldn’t be viewed as his email wasn’t on file….that’s not how the internet works, but that certainly didn’t stop them from trying. We wanted them to ship us the product they sold us (and are still selling, so what’s the issue?) at the price we paid (since we got it on sale). Not that hard. Instead, the supervisor hung up on us and issued a refund. If that hadn’t happened, we’d have claimed fraud through or bank. It’s still fraud, we just have our money back now. They knew they screwed up but refused to admit it or fix it and sent a refund to legally cover themselves. Additionally, they blocked us from leaving a review on the item and we’ve been blocked from contacting customer service regarding the order. I’ve since cancelled all related subscriptions and will not be renewing our prime membership when it expires. So long Amazon.

I have purchased a total of $2520 Xbox gift cards from Amazon for a research project. During my purchase process, I was told that Amazon suspected some fake purchase activities on my account and cancelled my orders and locked my account. After calling them, I was told several times that my account was restored and that I was good to go. That repeated a couple of times but I was able to purchase a total of $2520 Xbox gift cards.Then the fun started: When I redeemed the codes, the Microsoft Xbox system told me that some of the codes were already redeemed. The unredeemable codes added up to $610.So I contacted Amazon and was told to contact Microsoft/Xbox. I then contacted Microsoft/Xbox. After Microsoft/Xbox investigated this, they said that the $610 worth of gift codes were deactivated by Amazon before being sold to me. In other words, I received deactivated codes from Amazon.I then contacted Amazon again and was told to either dispute the $610 with my credit card company or continue asking if Microsoft/Xbox would re-issue me new codes of $610.Why asking a third party to pay for your mistakes? As of today, after three months of repeated conversation with Amazon, I am still not refunded for the $610 in total. What an unprofessional company that takes advantage of consumers and charge their money without offering the goods!

I ordered an external battery, airtags, and waterproof airtag covers. Some of the items were missing, and others arrived damaged beyond repair because the Amazon box had no packing around the individual items, and the weight of each item crushed other items and caused the tape to break on the Amazon box, allowing some of the items to fall out. I have contacted Amazon three times and spent over 3 hours on the phone, only to be hung up on. I have contacted them by chat 15 times with no help. One person finally said I would receive a refund but had lied. They told me to return the items through UPS, but UPS will not take the package because the items contain lithium and are dangerous to ship through the mail. I was then told to get a police report, but the police wouldn't write a report when the package was not stolen, and it was Amazon's fault for not packing the box properly. The items cost me $179.25, and I cannot get a refund, and Amazon refuses to help. They just reply with automated responses to return the items or get a police report. Still, I cannot do either because of the circumstances they caused by not packing the items properly for shipping. Buyer beware! Do not order expensive tech through Amazon because you cannot trust that they will be adequately packaged, and if they arrive damaged, Amazon will not issue a refund. I'm left with dangerous, useless items that I cannot dispose of.

Prime ..I agree with other posters here and other sites. Prime is no longer the 'next day delivery' promised. In fact paying Prime is now rip off becaue deliveries are the same without paying for it. In effect its a wste of money.Prime offers other  benefits --so they say . Music .. theres a rotten selection and only there to force you into subscribing to their millions of songs library . Its cheaper and better to get Spotify and forget Amazon music altogether.  During this year the music selection has been reduced continually . Now its useless. Asking for a song gets the generic response 'Heres a  station you might find if your lucky what you are lookng for '  Generally you dont . so thats another waste of time.Linking Spotify to the Echo account used to be easy . Now they make it difficult to force you into the poor Amazon Music.Amazon Prime Videos . another free benefit!!!   It offers nothing more than a few old movies . Far better is available elsewhere. Netfilx is FAR superior and at the same subcription price . Amazon is no competitor.Finally the Echo units 'age' and become deaf. I have 4 ... YES FOUR , in different continents and they all suffer from the same deafness problem. In my opinion its an inbuilt planned problem designed to make you buy another later version.  Dirty business practice.I wouldnt buy another echo..ever. I recommend you dont either.Nor would I subscribe to Prime. tyhose who have already done so would be well advised to review any benefit . They like me and others will conclude theres no value and cancel for refund

*** Truly DISAPPOINTING experiences ***I ordered an item, before finalizing the order I had a total for the item, the shipping and the Tax. Then I was prompted renew my Prime Membership and take advantage of Free Shipping and 2-3 days delivery. So, I said fine. I renewed my Prime Membership and clicked proceed. But I was still charged for Shipping and had to wait over two weeks for the order to arrive. Not only the total cost of the order stayed the same but also I had a 2-3 WEEKS delivery now!. So, practically no advantage or incentive to have Prime. I could cancel my membership online but I was curious as to why my Prim Membership was of no use. So I called the customer service.I spoke with the first representative whom I could hardly hear or understand. After a while he put me through to a supervisor. The lady supervisor pick up the line after about five minutes. I asked her the same question. She had no convincing answer. I then said OK, could you please cancel my Prime Membership. She said sure. She put me on hold again, then came back in about three minutes and said "OK I have canceled your order". I said why did you cancel my order? I just asked to cancel my USELESS Prime Membership. She simply said sorry, I can cancel your Prime NOW! What kind of people does Amazon hire. Not only they do not care but they do not listen either. I am truly disappointed at Prime. Then again, what can you expect from a company so big - and with no regards to Individual Customers.

This has been a very stressful experience for my wife and her father.We ordered an adjustable bed for my father in law who was being discharged from hospital he is 73 and in ill health so he has come to live with us he can’t get in and out of a normal bed so we ordered this one from Amazon as it would be delivered earlier than others we looked at with other companies as until than his sleeping on a sofa so we really need one asap.First the bed was to be delivered between the 18th-19th Nov than it was confirmed it would be delivered on 19th that was fine I took a day off work and lost a days pay but it had to be done the bed never arrived and no word to say what was happening than that night it was updated to say it’l now be delivered between 20th-25th so I messaged customer service who apologised and said they would refund me £7.99! Personally I find that an insult after waiting in all day and as I say losing a days pay.I was very surprised by Amazon as I’ve usually found the customer service is very helpful and knowledgeable.I asked to cancel the order but apparently that’s not possible and informed I would now have to refuse delivery at the door.I couldn’t get anywhere with customer service at all so I’m now closing my Amazon account and all connected accounts and will never use them again I just feel like they couldn’t be bothered to find a solution so I will never spend my money with them again.I now need to start looking elsewhere for a bed.My father in laws physio only agreed to discharging him when she knew the adjustable bed would be here asap if she had known it wasn’t being delivered his discharge from hospital would of been delayed until it did arrive.

I thought I should put an opinion on here to balance all the angry ones. I've been a customer since 2005 so I have plenty of experience of dealing with them. Before this year, I never had any particular issue - of course, occasionally things were delayed, but the tracking on their website or external couriers tells you  the expected due date, so there are no surprises. The goods have been as described, with rarely the odd error which was corrected when they were notified.The reason I'm posting now is because this Christmas (2021) several things went wrong; two packages weren't delivered - they got stuck at customs and never reappeared - and three things I bought all broke (a phone, a smartwatch and a belt for bad backs). All were ordered from abroad, so returning the items was a little more complicated than usual and involved arguing in the local village post office, who had no idea what to do with the labels and forms. However, Amazon themselves couldn't have been more helpful. In one case they changed the return label for a different courier because DHL wouldn't collect the package (that's another story, 'computer says no'). I had to phone Amazon three times to sort things out, and they did everything to make it as painless as possible.Whether a large corporation should survive by gobbling up the opposition is another question...but Amazon are, in my experience, reliable and generally cheaper. That's why I'm still using them after all this time.

I use Amazon all the time, but will always pick another retailer when reasonable. Their fulfillment system is too easily exploited by counterfeiters. Anyone can use their fulfillment system, and all items are combined together. When a retailer sells through Amazon (including Amazon itself), they pull an item from their shelf. Could be a counterfeit someone sent in or a legit item. You don't know.With more traditional retailers online, you know they buy their stock from reliable distributors so you know for sure you are getting the item/brand you paid for.

June 30th I ordered a hands free earpiece optional headset, I signed up for prime in order to get it before the 4th of July weekend.  That's the pitch rite??So, it takes a week to get my 'order', I opened it and it's not what I ordered!  Decided to go ahead and try using it because I was desperate for a hands free device.  It says refurbished on the outside, as soon as I try it on, the band that goes around your head is miss-shapen, very awkward and immediately comes apart from the main body. I called to straighten this out with Amazon, through two service reps that want me to return and have their wrong item received back before I can get a credit to re-order the correct product... I say bullcrap I signedup for Prime for this shxt, wrong product, bad service,  no deal!   ....I swear this shxt is fucjed up!  3rd Special service rep says she'll send a UPS driver to my door in next morning to pick up my repackaged product and I'll have a refund credit within an hour of the driver picking it up, I can reorder and life will be grand!!  5 days later I'm still coming home to this package in the door!! I just said everything will be great if this all happens!! 🙏🙏  today is the 16th of July , I'll be shocked if I can order and use that credit to get the right item I ordered within two days of reordering!!! Amazon seems to be slipping as to the reliability of the order dates. You know, the ones on the item detail page. For Example Prime member's, order is stated two days, sometimes three days. these order dates are always stated right on that page. But  following my last purchase, I received a notice that the item order date had been extended by two or three days. (So I canceled the purchase). And now I find that Prime Video has commercials... COMMERCIALS. Folks, I do not pay a monthly fee for commercials. I get enough of that with Directv. This was one reason I chose a prime membership. I do not pay a monthly fee to have my order date made LATE  by two or three days. The date on the item details page. (And I always take a screenshot of the page at the time of the purchase) should be the same price and date that the item is actually delivered. When I purchase items from Amazon, I often choose the item according to the order date and that price and order date should be honored by Amazon. If there are too many deliveries, hire more drivers. There are lots of people wanting jobs right now. Amazon needs to be a little bit more aware of their “little details”, like the order dates. It is now time to purchase items for Christmas. My question is, can I depend on Amazon with delivering the items on time? Or are my gifts going to arrive in 2021.

I ordered two chairs on Amazon and used my Amazon credit card. When I posted a review about the poor quality the chairs were and how poorly Amazon’s customer service behaved, they refused to post my review. They’ve posted every other review that I’ve made whether it was favorable or unfavorable about the item. However when it was unfavorable to them, they refuse to post it. Be very careful with Amazon and their credit card. With any other credit card you can dispute a charge but with Amazon credit card they won’t even answer the phone. The chairs were of poor quality and very difficult to put together. I requested the seller replace only one of the chairs because that was the only one that was broken upon delivery. They responded immediately that they would make it right and then they ignored my next three requests. So I tried to deal with Amazon directly and submitted a dispute and they totally blew me off. They said they get back with me in a week and I never heard from them. I placed another dispute and same process. So then I tried through the Amazon credit card and I couldn’t even get a customer service rep on the phone. And there’s no way to dispute a charge online. I will certainly never use my Amazon credit card again. While Amazon has pretty much everything you could want, they can’t behave as though you don’t matter at all.

I am giving the third star reluctantly; I would rather only give 2 1/2 out of 5 stars, as my feelings about the company are 50/50. Unfortunately, it is obvious that several of the reviews on the site are bogus, and until recently they would even allow trolls to write "counter reviews" to legitimate criticisms.  Where they really falter is in customer assistance.  I was locked out of my account for unknown reasons and I had to go through a whole rigmarole trying -- unsuccessfully -- to get back into it. As a longtime customer of Amazon.com, I have mixed feelings about my recent interactions with the company. While I can't deny the consistently decent quality of their goodss and assistances, I can't overlook the growing trend of additional charges for certain features. It has left me feeling moderately satisfied with my overall interaction.One aspect that has always stood out for me is the impressive range of goodss available on Amazon. Whether I'm looking for electronics, home decents, or even niche items, I can usually find what I need. The quality of the goodss I've purchased has generally been reliable, and I appreciate the convenience of having everything delivered right to my doorstep.However, my contentment has been somewhat dampened by the increasing number of features that come at an extra cost. Previously, I enjoyed the simplicity of a Prime membership, which included fast shipping and access to a decent selection of movies, TV shows, and books. Unfortunately, it seems like more and more perks are being pulled behind additional paywalls, which can be frustrating.For instance, the introduction of Amazon Prime Video Channels, which require separate subscriptions for certain content providers, has made the streaming interaction less appealing. It feels like I'm being nickel-and-dimed for every additional assistance, making it harder to justify the extra expenses.

Please ensure that you have a valid credit card uploaded in Account Settings."I have quadruple checked my credit card info matches my legal identity. That everything matches up 100%. Amazon Prime member for many years.  Getting very disillusioned with Prime shipment/promised shipment dates. Prime promises same day, next day, two day shipment depending upon the goods you order.  1) I expect delay of specific or some goodss due to COVID-19; and, 2) I understand not all goodss can be delivered in a day.  However, it's now October and I would expect Amazon to have worked-out the majority of promised shipment vs. actual shipment issues, regardless of whether it is an Amazon issue or Prime vendor issue.  Of the orders I have placed over the past 2-3 months, 80%+ have arrived later -- sometimes MUCH later -- than the shipment date stated/selected when I order.  In general, it is an inconvenience.  In principle, Amazon is not fulfilling the terms of their PAID Prime Service.  I would much rather order a goods and get an HONEST, REALISTIC shipment date than continue to get notifications that the goods I've ordered is delayed.  In some cases, I would not use Amazon if I knew that my order would not arrive for as much as a week to 10 days after the original shipment date.  Prime is a paid Service, with specific consumer promises.  Amazon needs to fulfill these promises or change them.  In all fairness, prior to COVID-19 the percentages of late packages was probably reversed (20% late/80% on time).  COVID is a challenge for everyone, and Amazon needs to step up to the plate to adjust their business practices to it.Side note:  First tried to review/leave feedback on the Amazon site but I'm ineligible to review Prime Service there.  Go figure...

Amazon Pickup Mix-Up 1/3/22I had two packages that were supposed to be shipped out to UPS, one of which was an Amazon return and the other of which would not go through. The package that did not go through contained photos I needed to get developed for a music festival I took pictures for. I owed the organizer images, as I was on the media team for the event. These were to be sent to Georgia. I called UPS to fix the issue with the latter package, and then the following day, someone came to pick up a package. I gave him the film in error, thinking UPS must have solved my issue, only to realize that he came for the Amazon return, not for the film.Calls 1/3/22Following this realization, I proceeded to call UPS, whose representative told me they could do nothing, and bounced me to Amazon, whose representative also told me they could do nothing. I asked her if they could leave something that would let the Amazon shipping center in Virginia (where it was headed) that when they got the package it should be returned to me. She said that Amazon had no such system and I would need to wait until the [package made it to the facility. I asked her if she could put me through to the facility in Virginia so I could tell them myself. She said she had no such ability. I asked if she could transfer me to someone who could contact them. She explained that there was no such person. I thanked her for her time and called UPS again. This time, UPS said they would issue an interception order to stop the package from arriving. I thanked the representative and concluded the call, feeling relieved.Calls 1/4/22The following day, I awoke to find a message from my Amazon app which stated that a refund was applied to my account for my return. Frustrated, I called Amazon again and spoke to someone about the issue. I explained the situation and asked if she could get the package sent back to me. She explained that she was sorry, but the person who spoke to me last gave me false information. There was, in fact, a system of tickets that could be created to notify a shipping facility of a package that should be returned to the sender upon arrival. She told me that since the package arrived at the facility that morning, it has likely been opened, inspected, and the contents thrown away without me being notified. I explained to her that this was a departure from what the other representative told me and that the pictures on the film were for a music festival and were irreplaceable She apologized and said she would file a ticket anyway, just in case, but that I should expect to not get my pictures back. Despite the package being there already (complete with a shipping label and tracking number to aid in its location), she said it would take up to 15 days for the facility to even view the ticket, meaning my package would likely be long gone. She sighed and stated that things "could have been very different" if the first Amazon representative gave me the correct information. I asked why the system takes 15 days when packages are delivered sometimes in less than 2 days. She did not have an answer to this question. Frustrated, I explained that what was originally a mixup due to my lapse of memory has become the imminent loss of irreplaceable photo work and film rolls which were valued at a combined $45. I asked who I should speak to to get compensation for this incident in the event that I never get my film rolls back. She said that there was no such department and that Amazon would not offer compensation because the rolls were no Amazon products. I thanked her for her time and concluded the call. Less than 10 minutes later, I called Amazon support again. I was determined to do everything I could to get my package back. The third representative told me some of the information the second representative gave me was incorrect. She explained that once the package is received by the facility, it is not opened immediately but is rather thrown in a pile with packages to be sorted. According to her, it could take the aforementioned 15 days to find the package and a whole month to return it to me if they succeeded in locating it. She too, however, stated that there was a chance I would never receive it, before doubling back and sending me an email that stated I would get a confirmation email when the package was found.AftermathI am beyond frustrated with Amazon Customer Service. I was given a wealth of false information and every representative had something different to say than the last. No information was consistent and I have barely been given any real help. I am now gearing up for another call to Amazon, in an attempt to speak to a supervisor of some sort. I pray this will bring some sort of positive conclusion to this incident. Those pictures are unbelievably important to myself and my roll as a designated photographer for the festival.

*DO NOT TRUST AMAZON*Everyone who has EVER purchased anything on Amazon check all of your bank statements very closely. Look for Prime that you have never subscribed to also for Amazon Music. When you place an order with a third party seller, they (Amazon) have a habit of "accidentally" signing you up to one of these subscription services and charging to ANY CARD that has been used to buy a product. Even if it is not in the name of the person who holds the Amazon account.Example! My 70 year old mother was being billed for Amazon music, she did not even know about this. It went on for months. Finally yesterday I got to the cause of it and Amazon has agreed to refund ALL 8 wrongfully claimed payments from a pensioner. That amounted to almost £80 STOLEN from a vulnerable person.They also agreed to refund the £9.99 STOLEN from my card. It only came to my attention when I used my mothers Amazon to order an item from a third party seller. When I checked my card. I had been charged £9.99 for Amazon music, as my mother's registered card was lost and had to be cancelled and replaced. So Amazon took the money without authorisation from my account. Just to add. I have now been charged £1 by amazon only a day after this scamming, thieving, fraudulent bunch of vultures "apologised" for stealing money. I therefore deleted both my card and my mother's card from amazon. I suggest EVERYONE does the same. If you buy anything on Amazon, DO NOT STORE YOUR CARD!!! Simply input it for each transaction. Your money is NOT SAFE!! Better than that NEVER USE AMAZON. We never will again!!Had this not happened, and I had not been charged my mother would never have known about this and Amazon would have continued pocketing her money. Along with their tax avoidance schemes. So be warned. This company openly admitted to me that the system sometimes "accidentally" subscribes when a purchase is made. The person who scripted Amazon's website must be a total amateur if this is what happens. So everyone get checking you statements, if you see one payment to AMAZON MUSIC or AMAZON PRIME, that you have not asked for, go to your bank (or call them) Order statements dating back to when you first started using Amazon. You may find more unauthorised charges. Also if you have elderly parents who use amazon help them check their account. Amazon do not pay tax correctly, why should they also get away with STEALING from vulnerable people.My mother's was almost £80, your refund could be more, It depends how long it has been ongoing. But every penny they have taken without permission will be refunded. And Amazon if you're reading this. ALL CARDS have now been removed from your scummy site and not one more order will be placed using Amazon. Sorry this is a long post but it needed explaining in case amazon are stealing from others. They certainly won't check their end, as long as they get their money coming in. So ensure you all check.I would love to have replies on here of anyone who checks their account and finds they have been unknowingly charged. I know for a fact amazon do it frequently, my bank told me this and even said they refund people OFTEN. So there is a good chance of you being owed and I would love to hear about your situation.Thanks for reading.
