I am giving Amazon three stars because I have had one positive and one negative interaction with Amazon customer assistance over many years. I ordered a settee from Amazon and was given a order date of Thursday.  All day Thursday Amazon showed that the settee was scheduled to arrive by 8 PM. It never arrived. I understood all of that, but on Friday the Amazon organization lost their credibility with me. On Friday, I received an email from Amazon saying they had a glitch and they would let me know when my item shipped and when it was expected to arrive. I read that to mean it could arrive in a week, six weeks, two months. I called customer assistance to get a more specific order date; they said they didn't know. I was told to call back next week to see if they had more information. They would give me no information as to why there was a delay in order. I have been a Prime member since the beginning and an Amazon customer long before that. I have never been left with such incompetent, open-ended information in my extended interaction with them. Perhaps they're getting too big for their boots.

I recently purchased a washing machine from Amazon, I paid for a brand new unit and what I got was somebody else’s return. When I received the unit it was badly damaged and it had water in it so that’s how I knew that it belonged to somebody else first and they returned it. Obviously they are taking in damaged and returned items repackaging them and then selling them as a new!

I ordered an external battery, airtags, and waterproof airtag covers. Some of the items were missing, and others arrived damaged beyond repair because the Amazon box had no packing around the individual items, and the weight of each item crushed other items and caused the tape to break on the Amazon box, allowing some of the items to fall out. I have contacted Amazon three times and spent over 3 hours on the phone, only to be hung up on. I have contacted them by chat 15 times with no help. One person finally said I would receive a refund but had lied. They told me to return the items through UPS, but UPS will not take the package because the items contain lithium and are dangerous to ship through the mail. I was then told to get a police report, but the police wouldn't write a report when the package was not stolen, and it was Amazon's fault for not packing the box properly. The items cost me $179.25, and I cannot get a refund, and Amazon refuses to help. They just reply with automated responses to return the items or get a police report. Still, I cannot do either because of the circumstances they caused by not packing the items properly for shipping. Buyer beware! Do not order expensive tech through Amazon because you cannot trust that they will be adequately packaged, and if they arrive damaged, Amazon will not issue a refund. I'm left with dangerous, useless items that I cannot dispose of.

This is more of a review on Amazon service!I took in a parcel from Amazon, for the property next door. It is a rental property and it turns out that the family moved out before Christmas so are not aware that I have this parcel.I took a photo of the label on the front and contacted Amazon to see if they could either trace the recipient so they can tell them to come and collect it, or at least arrange for one of their drivers to collect it and take it back to the depot.However on contacting Amazon I was told there was no way they can do this, and I can either keep the parcel or dispose of it!!Either of these options make me very uncomfortable, as it feels totally wrong!It does make me wonder how many goods are just kept or disposed of by people who are being neighbourly and basically doing Amazon’s job for them! I won’t be taking in any more parcels for that property from now on and will hang onto the one I have in case they realise they haven’t received it and come and ask if I have it here. What on earth would I do if they did that and I told them “ oh sorry, Amazon said I could just keep it “ I would be mortified.So my advice is, don’t take in anyone else’s parcels unless you know the neighbour well enough to know they haven’t moved house!

I am writing this review not in reference to any of the supplied goods from Amazon, which I have mostly always been happy with. Some supplied directly by Amazon, some by suppliers. But just as Amazon as a company.Your delivery drivers always come on the day they say they will. I appreciate that alot. I also appreciate the fact that when one of your drivers cannot find my house that they contact me and make sure they do. Sometimes your drivers leave a parcel on my doorstep when I'm not in and there are lots of hiding places here. So it would be better if they hid it and sent a picture like DPD. Sometimes they do move them out of view. But compared to Evri - you are winning. Your drivers deliver and I appreciate that now. In fact I'd say I took delivery drivers delivering for granted. Not anymore.Also- the couple of times I have had big problems, your employees have sorted it.1. Being charged tax on an expensive item that did not advertise there would be tax on the listing coming from abroad (they said all tax was included). You fixed it and the bill was sorted.2. My child spent over £1000 on game tokens when he got hold of my device and your refunded me. It took a while and a couple of attempts to sort out, but you did it.3. I had signed up accidentally to a prime feature without realising. You saw I hadn't used it and refunded me in whole. No problem.I appreciate the fact that when things went wrong that weren't even your fault, that you fixed them for me. Thanks.

Amazon scams people!!! I don’t order things from amazon often, but sometimes they do have some cool stuff. I ordered one thing. When I checked out there was option for a one time FREE prime delivery. I called the customer service and line and after talking to a stupid machine for 30 minutes I was transferred to a real person just to answer the same questions again! She said the package was delayed and won’t be here for 5 MORE DAYS!! No refund for the shipping. The free prime shipping trail is a scam. It is not free, and it is not any faster than the regular free shipping! My package was important and time sensitive and I would have paid for the faster shipping if I had known this would have been a huge issue! When I told the customer service rep that she immediately tried to refund me. I told her that I still wanted my item, but I wanted to cancel any further payments! VERY annoyed with the service of amazon in every aspect. I will not be order ever again unless this issue is resolved to satisfaction! It is not just OK for packages to be a week late and then receive no explanation!

Amazon uses third party sellers which may or may not honor refund request. Recently, I cancelled an expensive lighting fixture order, but the company sent it (after Amazon sent me a message saying the order was cancelled). I have been trying for almost two months to get a return label for a $500 item. Additionally, today, I received a NextBase 422GW car dash cam instead of a 622GW from a third party seller. This was a birthday gift for 9/22. My son helped me drive his birthday gift to an Amazon locker for return. The seller sent an old version at the new version price. And, last week, Amazon Warehouse delivered a microwave upside down with broken foam that was hugely dented inside and out for a small markdown. It looks like trash and cost $300 with tax. Now, I have to repackage this heavy item and bring it to UPS and go without a microwave, or reorder through Amazon (rewarding incompetence). Amazon has acceptable infrastructure (fast shipment, return lockers at third parity locations). It undoubtedly has greased some palms. Amazon has cut out its competitors, who now sell as third party vendors. Amazon is now careless. Yesterday, packages were thrown across my driveway to run over.

I have called customer support every time and they have simply said, it will be there tomorrow. It's a GUARANTEE. Yet they act like it's no big deal that your shipment isn't going to make it by the time they promised. So unless you plan on buying a fair number of order less than $25 save the money.

Purchase an item on the 24th aug 2023 , item was being sold by Amazon eu and advertised as in stock at time of sale . After sale I was informed delivery time to be confirmed. Nearly every day since purchase item has been advertised as in stock by Amazon eu . After contacting Amazon I was informed that the item was not in stock and also told that (in stock ) does not mean the item is in stock . Hear is what happened on 11/8/23 , the item said 13 in stock and while speaking the phone a Amazon advisor was able to tell me that there was now only 12 available while we were speaking, I asked the advisor could I not have one of the 12 and was told that is not how it works (lol) . So I pay for the item and Amazon won't deliver it but won't deliver it when it is clearly in stock and can't provide a delivery date . So if you see a item you like and is in stock, understand that the term (in stock ) written on a advertisement on Amazon platform does not actually mean (in stock) and what it does mean is very unclear.

I purchased an android 5G capable phone, on startup it took over an hour to complete, storage was 30% used - 70% available. I then began to reenter passwords and log into accounts and verify the IP address to the new device when I noticed that I didn't have administration rights on the new device because it hadn't completely wiped the old device and fragments of the applications remained. Which meant I needed to reboot the First new phone that I got so the IP address would register in the applications and I could make the transfer from within. After 4 hours of watching the screen turn and turn and tell me downloading and updating I powered off and put the phone away and try it again in a few hours. Extremely frustrated I called Amazon customer service back again today and made it very clear that they need to do something because I have to bring that phone now to a technician to have him go into the hard drive and extract my data. I want to say, everytime I purchase something that is "fulfilled' by Amazon; I have an issue. It is always the driver delivering it to the wrong address or not following the delivery instructions I provide.When it happens, customer service is usually good about it. Not this time.I received notice that my item was next to be delivered. About 10 minutes later, I received notice that it was delivered. The picture showed a rug outside the door it was left by. I do not have a rig by my door. I tried to call customer service and was told no one is answering due to the pandemic. I then got online and started chatting with a customer service rep. This was all within 5 minutes of the delivery notice. I asked them to have the driver come back, get the package and deliver it to the right address. The rep said it was scanned and marked as delivered by accident. I said, I suppose the app telling me I am the next stop, the package being placed in front of a door, the order marked as delivered and a picture being taken is all an accident as well? The rep said it was. Again, I asked for the driver to come back and deliver the package to me. The rep asked me to wait until tomorrow for delivery, despite me telling her several times it was already delivered. She continued to argue until I finally asked for my money back. My chat was transferred 2 times to a different rep. The 3rd one finally said he issued a refund. We shall see.

At first, I really loved using Amazon.  Their two-day order was spot on, and I could order anything and trust the item.  Now, it feels like I’m always trying to check with myself as to why I’m paying this membership!  Two-day order is bs.  I’ve had several two-day order packages be delayed.  One was a birthday present for my 6 year old nephew.  We postponed leaving until the next morning because Amazon said the order would be there in two days.  Right at the 9pm end of day order mark, Amazon sends a shipment delay note saying it may not be for another 5 days.  The tracking showed it was in my city.  Why would that take 5 days?!  Im beginning to wonder what I pay this membership for.  The two day shipping has gone to the wayside, and I’m beginning to not believe in Amazon’s promise any more...or the quality of the items sold.  Don’t say you can do something if you can’t.  False advertising, Amazon.  Maybe I should take my membership to Walmart, Amazon.  What do you think about that?  I’m not a fan, but they seem to be getting themselves squared away to be completion.

Amazon.com is a website so huge that its impossible to ignore their impact on society and retail as a whole, they have driven several competitors into bankruptcy including mom and pop stores who cant compete on price, small/medium sized competitors by lowering their prices on goodss (like baby goodss) which forces their small/medium sized competitor to lower prices to compete with Amazon and then after they go out of business Amazon will raise their prices when there is no competition around (this has been in news articles). Amazon has also been in the news for things like their poor treatment of fulfillment center employees by timing how many seconds they take to pick an order and pack it, limiting bathroom breaks, and making workers work during Covid-19 even though several of their employees got Covid-19 in their fulfillment centers.  So why do you ask do i keep buying from a company like this? for one simple reason, convenience. Amazon has a huge selection of goodss, they allow for easy and FREE returns within 30 days where other competitors charge restocking fees for returns and make returns at customer expense for shipping costs. Amazon also has a presence in many countries, ive purchased stuff from Amazon Japan, Amazon UK and had the items shipped to the United States very easily.So why did I rate Amazon.com 3/5? well because while they may be very convenient to buy from they also have very poor packaging and dont let customers specify what kind of packaging they want their items shipped in. Amazon has gotten some heat from environmental groups trying to get them to cut down on plastic and cut down on cardboard boxes in the past and we still see petitions online constantly being opened about their packaging. A simple solution would be to let the customer choose what kind of packaging they want their items shipped in during the checkout process and if theres an extra costs associated with more packaging materials then the customer can decide if they want to pay the extra costs or not. I would totally welcome the ability to choose what packaging material Amazon uses for my orders because I would love to be able to order things like art books, movies, collectibles, and video games from Amazon but whenever I try to order any of these items from Amazon they ship the items in a plastic padded envelope 99% of the time or a cardboard box without any packing paper or void fillers and when I finally receive the item it will be all scuffed up or dented during shipping, have a loose disc (movies and video games), or be damaged in some other way so I would have to go through the trouble of returning the item back to Amazon which isnt decent for the environment either since it would costs more fuel and packaging material to be sent back to Amazon. The combination of Amazon's business practices, their poor treatment of fulfillment center employees, and their poor quality packaging which prioritizes getting the package to the customer as fast as possible over the condition that the items arrive in at their destination are the reasons why I gave Amazon a 3/5 score.

I've been loyally using Amazon for around ten years now, but my experience with it in 2024, especially within the last two or three months, has been absolutely dreadful. The two most common complaints I have to give, and the most annoying -1. Orders being delayed or outright being lost. I had an order that was out for delivery, then it kept being delayed until I was told it would arrive by 10pm, then it was delayed by two days, and the same thing just happened but this time delayed by four days. How can an order be OUT FOR DELIVERY and then end up being delayed by days?2. The refund system. I was told by an automated service that I'd be refunded for said cases above, but the system then told me I'd be refunded once the items are returned. I contacted one of the agents and questioned how can I return something that didn't arrive, and thankfully they agreed and refunded me. I don't know what's changed internally, but Amazon used to have reliable delivery and a reliable refund system. In the past months it's just completely gone downhill. I won't be using them from here on out. Do yourself a favour and use one of the many alternatives that now exist, there are plenty of great websites out there that are currently much better.

I used Amazon to buy books many years ago, never have any problem.  But when I start buying electronics from them, I have to find out the hard way that if it malfunction after one month while under warranty, Amazon don't care.  Go deal with the manufacturer yourself.  Recently I also start to sell on Amazon because of eBay fee hike, but it is quite a disappointment.  If you think 10% fee on eBay is bad, Amazon charges 15% plus 99cent per item if you don't fork out 40 buck a month for pro account, plus another $1.35 each if it is 'Media products'.  That's 26.7% for a 20 buck DVD!  Plus all the illiterate, ignorant, or downright retarded customers I came across on Amazon which I've never seen on eBay for the past 12 years.  But since they're there, I priced all my Amazon listings 15 to 50% more than my eBay listing to justify the hassle.Listing items on Amazon is also a beetch.  If your product doesn't have UPC or EAN, you will have to buy one or steal one from a soup can.Another note for people who cares about seller feedbacks.  9 out of 10 customers on eBay leave feedback because they want 1 back.  1 out of 3 customers on eCrater leave feedback because customer doesn't get feedback rating.  Only 1 out of 5 customers on Amazon leave feedback because they can read and write and their parents are not siblings.

I made an amazon account because i was given an amazon gift card. I purchased a roblox gift card using the amazon gift card, and my amazon account was locked because somehow me buying a roblox card is suspicious. Whatever. I put in my information to get my account unlocked, and a few hours later, my account still wasn't unlocked. However a new notification appeared when i tried to log in saying they reviewed the information i sent but they still need more. It said to follow the instructions in the text message they sent me, but the text message they sent me tells me to log in, but when i log in it tells me i need to follow the text message instructions. Makes sense? No? Great because i was confused too. The text message had no "instructions". I called customer service and the tl; dr is "sorry idk how to help u lol bye". I thought i would just try again and make a new account, so i did. I tried to load my gift card again and it said the gift card was locked.Tl; dr - amazon locked my account the moment i tried to buy something, and froze my amazon gift card essentially stealing 25 dollars from me with no hope of getting it back.How can you avoid an experience like this?Dont buy from amazon. Buy from the home store of the sellers on amazon. Not only does it keep money out of greedy bezos's pockets, not only can it be cheaper than buying from amazon, but it also helps you avoid every single painful moment i spent on the amazon website. This was quite literally the worst experience ive ever had while on the internet. Dont ask for amazon gift cards for your birthday or christmas. Ask for visa gift cards. Theyre like amazon gift cards except you can buy anything, not just amazon stuff.Final thoughts - my first impressions of amazon are as followed: amazon scammed me out of my money, if your account gets locked (which i guess happens every time you try to buy something?) just give up and delete your account because you aren't gonna get it back. Did you have gift cards loaded onto that account? Say bye bye to that money because you just got scammed. Avoid amazon at all costs.

I have 2 issues with Amazon. I have an issue with having to send things back via UPS, we don't have a UPS store here. You can, however, print out a label they will send you, and you can put it in the UPS Dropbox, however we don't have those and I don't have a printer! So if I get things that don't fit or I just don't like them I cannot send them back and I'm stuck with them. It gets old. The second issue I have is their packaging. Most of the time you get 1 or 2 small items in a large box, what a waste. sometimes they come in plastic envelopes and are smashed because there's no protection.I'd rather have small boxes because then they fit in the parcel lockers at the Post Office and I don't have to take off of work early to go pick up my packages because they don't fit. I can recycle the cardboard, I just think it's stupid to put a calendar in a box that you could fit 10 pairs of shoes in it. I've contacted them several times about these issues and have yet to see a response. And I use amazon ALOT!

Jeff Bezos has the unique privilege on being classified as a rilobber baron alongside many early 20th century figures. Amazon Export Services (AES) employs the cheapest 1* rated companies for international deliveries. It makes it imposdible to record a complaint. It tells a lot of lies on its invoice about how it will handle import processes. In New Zealabd, if your package is worth more than 1000 nzd, for which you have already paid import fees, your package sits in limbo forever. Aramex NZ, which Anazon employs, is a frachisee provider. There is one customs broker who tells a lot of lies about how the the package is due soon, when it has been held by customs for 17days. Mr Azmir Siddiqui (AamirS- his domain name is aramex.com in case you need to put his contact details together) is not inclined to respond to emails. The contact centre is in the phillipines and likely to hang up on you. Aamir is a bottleneck and nothing happens. He probably has too much paperwork in between delivery of 1* rated uber eats. Mr Danny Murphy, supposedluly the Canterbury General Manager of Aramex NZ (1.3* rating only because you cannot rate zero) is uncontactable. This is Amazon for you. The customer can only rate the seller who is not to blame. Customer cannot rate AES. Cunning.

Amazon charges for Prime service, then offers 2 and 3 day shipping as a benefit for your paying more that $100 annually for it.  However, they reserve the right to break this agreement when it suits them. If for whatever reason they can't get your item to you within the time stated (even though it's listed as a prime item) the excuses from customer service vary from "The item wasn't in one of our depots" to "This item has been delayed and hasn't reached your local facility" or just plain lies promising the delivery will make it the next day. So don't count on, or expect an item to be delivered when promised. And don't expect to be treated like a "Prime" customer when you call for answers. Their customer service supervisors will be rude when they feel like it, and just hang up on you if they want and apparently there's no path of escalation for this behavior. I've canceled all of my recurring subscriptions and will cancel my Prime membership before it renews. Amazon is very convenient, but it's not worth the frustration, stress and rude treatment I've received from their customer service team.

This review is regarding Amazon and their misleading advertisements, which this is hardly the first time they have been accused of such and likely not the last settlement they have to pay out due to misleading statements. During the wake of our current pandemic they choose to keep profits high by making unachievable promises to unsuspecting customers regarding their shipping policies. I also a fool agreed to sign up with Amazon prime and pay 119$ a year for this two day shipping reward. As I checkout excited at the decision I made only to discover I will be lucky to receive my shipment in 3 weeks. Upon inquiring with a customer service representative they chose to guilt me as of why I expect my shipment as previously promised to me two minutes prior when they are too busy sending out medical equipment for healthcare professionals. Of course we all understand the need and importance of medical equipment at a time like this, but why are you tricking people into signing up if you know that you aren't able to supply what is promised. Of course her response was, "well just cancel your order then." Which of course can be done, but it's the principal of it all and their willingness to profit off of the unsuspecting and unaware. We all know how this works, no one remember to cancel in time or they are elderly or disabled and unsure of the process. Now they are not even required to supply what is advertised. Most would be understanding had they been truthful at the start, but to fabricate and make false statements and to guilt customers for asking for what was just offered to them is bad business in itself. Now had I signed up a year ago and there was no way of predicting the outcome of what could happen it would be reasonable, but covid 19 has been present and affecting all for months now. If you can't supply as promised then take the advertisement down instead of continuing to mislead consumers. Of course our star customer service members response was now, "I don't know why they haven't took down the advertisement yet, they are probably busy with all this covid stuff." My....how I should chose my words wisely....as if removing a single line of advertisement will take months to do. While they are so busy saving the world from Covid 19. Thank you Amazon. I got a laugh at least, even if I didn't get my shipment. Until next time, which will be sooner than you think.

I am giving the third star reluctantly; I would rather only give 2 1/2 out of 5 stars, as my feelings about the company are 50/50.  As far as prompt order and fair pricing goes, Amazon is second to none.  Unfortunately, it is obvious that several of the reviews on the site are bogus, and until recently they would even allow trolls to write "counter reviews" to legitimate criticisms.  Where they really falter is in customer assistance.  I was locked out of my account for unknown reasons and I had to go through a whole rigmarole trying -- unsuccessfully -- to get back into it.  The belligerent, unapologetic operator I spoke to was acting as if I had put HIM out.  I couldn't take it anymore and disconnected the call.  Later, I was inexplicably able to access my account but it was no thanks to them.  They really need to clean up their act.  Goodness knows they can afford to.

Amazon now is making a habit of notifying customers that their order has been delivered, when in fact, it was not delivered. And when you call to ask why, I am told that many times the system will mark a package delivered when it was not delivered. I have to wait 24 hours, and if I still do not find the package, I can claim I never received it. Amazon used to brag about being "customer eccentric", now I understand why I'm not seeing that anymore.
Had some issues with order secret santa present. Wasn't the quality that it looked, and requested refund.

Good pricing, decent goodss, but when they mess up, they mess up ordinary with little to no compensation.I’ve bought from Amazon many times.  When their customer assistance agents say someone will get back to you, know that they will never get back to you.  Have heard that at least a dozen separate times and never once has anyone got back to me.They can usually correct things pretty quick, but the problems thst get them there are usually pretty ordinary and they do nothing or very little to mitigate the issue.Overall I still buy from them because of the pricing but I am starting to slow down on purchases because their poor resolution on multiple problems has had me spend way too much time on the phone with them correcting their mistakes while I am actually paying to correct them for them, by being a customer.I have also caught them in their own policy lies and have it recorded where the agent refuses to put in writing what he says on the phone, even though he will put other things in writing.  I asked him directly; why will you say it on the phone to me and not put it in writing, he said because he isn’t obligated to do that.  Unbelievable.I think this company is dealing with the massive influx of sales during the pandemic and though I have little sympathy for the trillions in profit... overall they do pretty decent job... when they mess up it can be pretty ordinary... but usually they don’t mess up and usually things will sort out.  I wish I could more easily support Canadian retailers though.

Ordered an item that cost $317 compared to the MSRP of $449. Received the order quickly, but because somebody at the warehouse put the correct stock label on the wrong product I was sent an item that was completely wrong and with a price point $165 less than what I ordered. Customer service has been an absolute nightmare trying to get the return set up. First I had to e-mail photos of the packaging and everything else to which their reply was that it was invalid and I had to re-submit the exact same thing all over again. Finally got the approval for a return. Second they tell me they can't replace the incorrect item with the correct one and that I would have to get a refund and try ordering again. Then they couldn't send me the correct e-mail with the correct return shipping labels for me to print to apply to the return box. It took 8 different emails to finally get the right link to print the proper labels. Sent the item back by USPS with a tracking number on 6/27 and it was delivered on 6/29. The return center took 4 days until 7/3 to finally acknowledge it as received and it would take 2-3 days to process the refund and another 2-3 for the refund to appear back on my card.It's now been nearly two weeks and I still haven't gotten my refund. Call to find out what is going on and I'm told that I can't get refunded until I send back the correct item. Because of their moronic mistake of putting the correct stock label on the incorrect item their system shows that I received the correct item. It was shown with photographic proof in the initial return photos that the label with the correct item name/number was literally 3 inches away from the incorrect name/number on the product box it was placed on, but they're too incompetent to get that through their heads. I can't return what I never received. Now it's just one big runaround to get these scumbags to give me my money back. These incompetent morons will never get another dime from me after this ridiculous hassle over a simple return of their stupid mistake.

Amazon Prime member for many years.  Getting very disillusioned with Prime shipment/promised shipment dates. Prime promises same day, next day, two day shipment depending upon the goods you order.  1) I expect delay of specific or some goodss due to COVID-19; and, 2) I understand not all goodss can be delivered in a day.  However, it's now October and I would expect Amazon to have worked-out the majority of promised shipment vs. actual shipment issues, regardless of whether it is an Amazon issue or Prime vendor issue.  Of the orders I have placed over the past 2-3 months, 80%+ have arrived later -- sometimes MUCH later -- than the shipment date stated/selected when I order.  In general, it is an inconvenience.  In principle, Amazon is not fulfilling the terms of their PAID Prime Service.  I would much rather order a goods and get an HONEST, REALISTIC shipment date than continue to get notifications that the goods I've ordered is delayed.  In some cases, I would not use Amazon if I knew that my order would not arrive for as much as a week to 10 days after the original shipment date.  Prime is a paid Service, with specific consumer promises.  Amazon needs to fulfill these promises or change them.  In all fairness, prior to COVID-19 the percentages of late packages was probably reversed (20% late/80% on time).  COVID is a challenge for everyone, and Amazon needs to step up to the plate to adjust their business practices to it.Side note:  First tried to review/leave feedback on the Amazon site but I'm ineligible to review Prime Service there.  Go figure...

Amazon customer service is Appalling!  I needed to return two damaged items and went through the returns process online.  The courier arrived on 3 occasions to collect them.  Each time with a car when, as items are heavy and bulky, a van is needed.  After each failed attempt I have contacted customer service by live chat and telephone.  Further collections were supposedly arranged with Hermes who didn’t turn up even after I waited in on days for them.  At this point I had contacted them at least 8 times.  The whole experience was utterly frustrating.  On 2 occasions the call was disconnected.  Eventually Amazon customer service told me I have to arrange my own courier and they will refund.  However, I tried again and, after explaining all the details again, this assistant said she went through to the large items department and had arranged the collection for the following Tuesday.  Again a courier didn’t turn up.  I tried to contact Hermes direct.  They only provide digital chat.  I inputted the parcels tracking number and waited about a week for a digital response which said they couldn’t locate the parcel.  I then went online to arrange my own courier.  The cheapest courier costs £126 yet the item cost £90.  I contacted Amazon again to check they would refund this large amount.  He said yes.  But as so many CS advisers have told me different things I don’t trust anything they say.  I am now left with two large and heavy items unlike want or can afford to fork out £126 for their return.  It definitely is the worst customer service I’ve ever experienced and I will not buy anything through them again.

I use Amazon a lot. And for the most part it's fine. However just recently it's been a bit of a joke. A couple of items arrived damaged. Thankfully it's just the box not the goods itself but it makes you wonder about how they treat your items. Then I also pay for Amazon Prime, the idea being next day order. Ordered an item and didn't receive it next day. Following day I got a notification to say it would arrive with a couple of additional items i bought as accessories for my main item. The additional items came but not the main one. Message from them saying there was a problem and I was to wait 2 more days and then I could request a refund. Wasn't sure if that meant I wasn't getting it or not, even though it said they would redeliver it 2 days later (3 days after the order date I pay a premium for). But why even bring up the option of a refund if you intend to deliver my item? Then at just before 2am, I get a message saying I won't get it at all. And I will get a refund in a couple of days. So I pay a premium for you to make me wait longer than expected and then not send the item and make me wait for a refund. No explanation either. It's really annoying. Makes me think twice about using them again and makes me wonder about Prime membership.
Always happy with their customer service. I just wish that they have a better quality control/check on the products sold as sometimes the quality is not so good.

I’m writing this review to tell the truth about amazon.com. I have been a member for several years and even though I have bought many items of good quality, some of the items sold were in poor state. I am warning customers to do your homework and research the individual sellers. Some of them are not honest and some either were damaged, defective or otherwise false goods. Furthermore, Amazon disallows bad reviews regarding late or in accurate deliveries that failed to arrive on time. This is a concern to me because it appears Amazon is only interested in profits and not customer satisfaction. They need to do better with the respective delivery companies charged with making sure things are delivered on time and to the correct address. It’s inconceivable and inexcusable for Amazon not to properly vet their sellers and deliver to the correct address on time.

I had the EXACT book as the website (Same ISB #, same edition, etc.), and they sent it back to me saying it wasn't the right book. Amazon seems to be slipping as to the reliability of the order dates. You know, the ones on the goods detail page. For Example Prime member's, order is stated two days, sometimes three days. these order dates are always stated right on that page. But  following my last purchase, I received a notice that the goods order date had been extended by two or three days. (So I canceled the purchase). And now I find that Prime Video has commercials... COMMERCIALS. Folks, I do not pay a monthly fee for commercials. I get enough of that with Directv. This was one reason I chose a prime membership. I do not pay a monthly fee to have my order date made LATE  by two or three days. The date on the goods details page. (And I always take a screenshot of the page at the time of the purchase) should be the same price and date that the goods is actually delivered. When I purchase goodss from Amazon, I often choose the goods according to the order date and that price and order date should be honored by Amazon. If there are too many deliveries, hire more drivers. There are lots of people wanting jobs right now. Amazon needs to be a little bit more aware of their “little details”, like the order dates. It is now time to purchase items for Christmas. My question is, can I depend on Amazon with delivering the goodss on time? Or are my gifts going to arrive in 2021.

Amazon has become the way of the world. We can find anything we need at the edge of our finger tips + 2 day prime shipping?! SIGN ME UP! I’ve worked hand in hand with Amazon and their affiliate program which has been wonderful. I’ve also ordered many of my own personal things through the site as well. From clothes, to toilet paper and even random items like a pineapple carver LOL. They have a large variety of items and various vendors to choose from. The only issue I’ve really ever had is they tend to lose my packages. I even have an Amazon hub at my apartment complex where they can drop off the package directly. It’s always frustrating when something doesn’t arrive on time or gets lost some way some how in transit. However, Amazon has always swooped right in to help save the day. Their customer service is awesome! I’m more of a pick up the phone type of gal. I like that one on one customer service (it must be the sales person in me) but Amazon does also offer a chat service where you can speak to a representative directly. I’ve had phone calls and chats with them but I’ve had instances before where I can’t leave my desk to make a phone call. Easily enough I’ve gotten right on the chat, let them know my package was missing and they have sent a new one right out to me. Easy peasy! I’ve had really great service and have always been satisfied with the overall experience of the company itself. I would highly recommend checking them out!!

Amazon's Preston warehouse has thieves working out of it. Some of you might be aware of the recent incidents of people buying PS5's from Amazon and upon delivery the console box had been opened and the console taken out the box and then delivered to customers. Well this also happens when you buy a mobile phone. Ordered a OnePlus 9 model (most recent model) and upon delivery took the phone box out of the outer packing and immediately noticed the seals had been cut and upon opening the phone box found the phone had been removed. I spent over 2 hours trying to get in touch with someone at Amazon who understood the situation but was bounced around the Philippines, Columbia and the Caribbean before getting through to someone in the UK who understood the situation. I was offered £5 as a good will gesture which you'll agree was insulting so did not accept it and was assured a member of management would contact me to discuss further and have not received a call, no surprise there being it's Amazon. The agents I spoke to we're more interested in trying to cover up and ignore the fact they have thieves working in their Preston warehouse, basically trying their best to brush it under the carpet. Next step is the police and the press to report the theft and I hope anyone who reads this will think twice before purchasing a high priced or sought after item from Amazon...I assure you you'll have issues and then more issues trying to resolve it with their utterly useless customer services. It shows how little Amazon thinks of its customers as they don't even monitor their own trust pilot and respond to reviews, they're so big now they simply don't care about criminality within their own company. You've been warned, purchase from Amazon at your own risk.

Amazon charges for Prime service, then offers 2 and 3 day shipping as a benefit for your paying more that $100 annually for it.  However, they reserve the right to break this agreement when it suits them. If for whatever reason they can't get your item to you within the time stated (even though it's listed as a prime item) the excuses from customer service vary from "The item wasn't in one of our depots" to "This item has been delayed and hasn't reached your local facility" or just plain lies promising the delivery will make it the next day. So don't count on, or expect an item to be delivered when promised. And don't expect to be treated like a "Prime" customer when you call for answers. Their customer service supervisors will be rude when they feel like it, and just hang up on you if they want and apparently there's no path of escalation for this behavior. I've canceled all of my recurring subscriptions and will cancel my Prime membership before it renews. Amazon is very convenient, but it's not worth the frustration, stress and rude treatment I've received from their customer service team.

Okay so my problem with amazon originally started as my fault, i put the wrong address. Instead of putting west I put east. On the day of the delivery the driver called me, I apologized and gave him the correct address, and he told me he would update the address and I would get it delivered the following day. Cool.So the following day I check my shipping address at 6 am, and it wasn't corrected. I did the chat thing and the chatter informed me that she added it to the delivery instructions. Skeptical, I called in and the lady on the phone confirmed with me I would receive the package today at the corrected address.A few hours go by and I receive a call from the driver that he was at the wrong address, yet again, and when I gave him the corrected address he said it was outside of his delivery zone.So I call in again and after a 30 minute phone call of just trying to update my address for the following day, the guy told me he updated the notes and address. Address was still incorrect and delivery notes were deleted and he put that I wanted my order the following day.So I then do the chat thing again and they inform me to replace the order and I would get a full refund, which would've worked but I had ordered the last item in stock. So I ask if I can update the address and they tell me no and ask if I want to speak to a specialist.I understand the mistake was originally my fault but it is a simple mistake and I was willing to wait a few days to accommodate that but they have no basic understanding of what I am asking for.

Two months ago I would have given them 5 stars. I have been an Amazon Prime member for a couple of years now. I have always loved this company and web site.., and then came covid-19!!! I am not complaining about the slower (much slower) shipping... we all have to adjust to aid each other. What I am talking about is their goods line & what they have aided Chinese companies in doing. For instance: I wanted to find “hand sanitizer.”  If you go to the other well-known ‘brick and mortar’ sites you will find it marked, “Out of stock” and there will be no “cheap” substitutes. Amazon owes it to their customers to maintain some quality control. Instead they are stocking many, very many substitutes that did not exist before. Also, they have allowed the price on “junk” to go through the roof. Read the review, the comments on these outrageously priced & newly appearing Chinese made hand sanitizers. It is absolutely nothing but a rip-off. Amazon should start listing items as “sold out” & stop aiding these companies with no quality control in flooding our markets with overpriced garbage. It is Amazon’s decent name that will suffer. We expect Amazon to do at least a little policing of the goodss they sell, and prices that have quadrupled in a month’s time. I hope the Amazon name will mean as much “post” covid-19 as it did “pre” covid-19!!!

Customers refuse to go to either one because they can get then cheaper on Amazon.  Don't buy Amazon!  Wal-Mart does the same thing but Amazon put john in bankrupty and then bought John's business for pennies.  You May want it cheaper but you're hurting small businesses for the convenience of "1 day delivery"

I'm absolutely disgusted in the lack of service Amazon provided me when I tried to return a faulty item. I purchased an inflatable bed for my disabled daughter earlier this year, and last week the bed started to blow up in the centre like a balloon. The bed comes with a 2 year Amazon warranty, so didn't expect any issues. I called them over the weekend, and was instructed to email them a picture, to which they didn't even reply. I then decided to call them again today, following on from my email. I explained the situation, going into more details, about how we were involved in a house fire, and was extremely lucky to still be alive, and that the inflatable bed, was a temporary bed for my disabled daughter, due to the house fire, and the main house and contents being destroyed. The annex is only a one bedroom, with one double bed, and the inflatable bed that my daughter uses. I explained that the fault was affecting my daughters sleep, who has already been through so much in the last year, and I would therefore need an urgent replacement. I was then informed, that the bed I purchased wasn't their own stock and therefore, the bed would need to be returned to the supplier, for them to send out a replacement bed. In the meantime, my disabled daughter, will have to sleep on the floor; "I'm sorry there is nothing our billion pound company can do about this"... To add to my frustration, to replace the bed, it is now 2x the cost of when I purchased the bed in March. How very convenient... There is no wonder this man can afford to travel to space, in his own space rocket, treating loyal customers, like their own life's mean nothing. Bad move Mr Bezos All future business cancelled, and my monthly subscription to Amazon prime. Account closed.  Deal direct from here forth...

*DO NOT TRUST AMAZON*Everyone who has EVER purchased anything on Amazon check all of your bank statements very closely. Look for Prime that you have never subscribed to also for Amazon Music. When you place an order with a third party seller, they (Amazon) have a habit of "accidentally" signing you up to one of these subscription services and charging to ANY CARD that has been used to buy a product. Even if it is not in the name of the person who holds the Amazon account.Example! My 70 year old mother was being billed for Amazon music, she did not even know about this. It went on for months. Finally yesterday I got to the cause of it and Amazon has agreed to refund ALL 8 wrongfully claimed payments from a pensioner. That amounted to almost £80 STOLEN from a vulnerable person.They also agreed to refund the £9.99 STOLEN from my card. It only came to my attention when I used my mothers Amazon to order an item from a third party seller. When I checked my card. I had been charged £9.99 for Amazon music, as my mother's registered card was lost and had to be cancelled and replaced. So Amazon took the money without authorisation from my account. Just to add. I have now been charged £1 by amazon only a day after this scamming, thieving, fraudulent bunch of vultures "apologised" for stealing money. I therefore deleted both my card and my mother's card from amazon. I suggest EVERYONE does the same. If you buy anything on Amazon, DO NOT STORE YOUR CARD!!! Simply input it for each transaction. Your money is NOT SAFE!! Better than that NEVER USE AMAZON. We never will again!!Had this not happened, and I had not been charged my mother would never have known about this and Amazon would have continued pocketing her money. Along with their tax avoidance schemes. So be warned. This company openly admitted to me that the system sometimes "accidentally" subscribes when a purchase is made. The person who scripted Amazon's website must be a total amateur if this is what happens. So everyone get checking you statements, if you see one payment to AMAZON MUSIC or AMAZON PRIME, that you have not asked for, go to your bank (or call them) Order statements dating back to when you first started using Amazon. You may find more unauthorised charges. Also if you have elderly parents who use amazon help them check their account. Amazon do not pay tax correctly, why should they also get away with STEALING from vulnerable people.My mother's was almost £80, your refund could be more, It depends how long it has been ongoing. But every penny they have taken without permission will be refunded. And Amazon if you're reading this. ALL CARDS have now been removed from your scummy site and not one more order will be placed using Amazon. Sorry this is a long post but it needed explaining in case amazon are stealing from others. They certainly won't check their end, as long as they get their money coming in. So ensure you all check.I would love to have replies on here of anyone who checks their account and finds they have been unknowingly charged. I know for a fact amazon do it frequently, my bank told me this and even said they refund people OFTEN. So there is a good chance of you being owed and I would love to hear about your situation.Thanks for reading.

My Amazon delivery driver today is an absolute legend! I really wish I knew his name but I'll leave feedback on the app also in the hope he gets recognised. He was holding a parcel behind his back and he asked me if the parcel was for me as it had my name on it. I explained my partner ordered it on the account. He asked if it was a Christmas present for me, to which I said yes. He said it wasn't in additional packaging, so I would see what it is, so he asked how I wanted to receive the package. He very kindly came into my porch to hide the package so my surprise wouldn't be ruined! How thoughtful!! I've never had a delivery driver so thoughtful and kind - how amazing! it must be such a busy/stressful time on 23rd dec and yet he still took the time to help (and waited at the door a long time as it took me ages to find my key). I always get deliveries quickly and efficiently but this was exceptional!! Thank you!!

Amazon can be both fine and average. When it's fine, it will take your orders and deliver them smoothly. (rolled eyes)I will always cancel order when they try to charge my debit card a second time. They can very well take the money that was previously put on hold but nope, they want to charge again! So I will always cancel and bring my business elsewhere even if it costs a little more.My recent order was with the same debit card and they did not charge twice. Just once, take the money and delivered the fines. Now why can't they just do that all the time?? Charging twice is off putting and defo made me shop elsewhere every time they try sh_t like that with my debit card. They can go borrow money from the bank if they need floating cash.
